1.text: My son, attend unto my wisdom, incline thine ear to my understanding;

2.text: that thou mayest keep reflection, and that thy lips may preserve knowledge.

3.text: For the lips of the strange woman drop honey, and her mouth is smoother than oil;

4.text: but her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.

5.text: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on Sheol.

6.text: Lest she should ponder the path of life, her ways wander, she knoweth not [whither].

7.text: And now, children, hearken unto me, and depart not from the words of my mouth.

8.text: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:

9.text: lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel;

10.text: lest strangers be filled with thy wealth, and the fruits of thy toil [come] into the house of a stranger;

11.text: and thou mourn in thine end, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed;

12.text: and thou say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof!

13.text: and I have not hearkened unto the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to those that instructed me;

14.text: I was well nigh in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.

15.text: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.

16.text: Thy fountains shall be poured forth, as water-brooks in the broadways.

17.text: Let them be only thine own, and not strangersâ€™ with thee.

18.text: Let thy fountain be blessed; and have joy of the wife of thy youth.

19.text: As a lovely hind and a graceful roe, let her breasts satisfy thee at all times: be thou ravished continually with her love.

20.text: And why shouldest thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?

21.text: For the ways of man are before the eyes of Jehovah, and he pondereth all his paths.

22.text: His own iniquities shall take the wicked, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sin.

23.text: He shall die for want of discipline; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
